newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - AWB Report-All steady on price and crop.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - AWB Report-All steady on price and crop.

text.p: The Australian Wheat Board's (AWB) indicator price remained steady A$169.75 a tonne during the past week, AWB said in its weekly grain market report.
The AWB said the impact of recent frost in Queensland and northern New South Wales was still being assessed.

Early indications were that the AWB would trim about 100,000 tonnes from the previously anticipated 1.8 million tonnes wheat production in Queensland but this was a "very early assessment", it said. The AWB has held its estimate of the 1996/97 crop steady at 17.6 million tonnes in its latest weekly report.
The increase in the AWB's estimated pool returns for Australian Hard Wheat and Prime Hard wheat by A$5 a tonne were not reflected in cash market prices last week, the AWB said.
Milling wheat prices were either steady or slightly down in Queensland and NSW, though they did firm by A$3.00 a tonne in Victoria for higher protein grades, it said.
The U.S. wheat crop continued to get bigger and the prospect of frost having a significant impact on the Canadian crop was now receding, it said.
